page.title: 11BRIGHTON'S OLDEST HOUSE
page.content: The house is called the Monks House. It is a cottage with 2 rooms upstairs and 2 rooms downstairs. People do not live in the cottage now, but it is used for people to have a drink. Down in the cellar there is a well, people think that a person once fell down it and became a ghost. Her name was the "Lady in Grey" ! The doors to the old cottage are very small which indicates that the people in those days must have been small to get through the them. In the cottage there is an oven which is not like the ovens we use today. Near the cottage there is a barn and some of the wood used to make the barn came from a ship in the Spanish Armada. In the cellars, where they stored wine,the ceiling is coming down. The windows are made from small panes of glass, & to open them you slide the whole frame back.
